characters: WE COME AROUND SO WE FINALLY SEE HESTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LYNN, asleep, squirms on the bed. She's early thirties, v pretty, thin-bodied. She MUMBLES in discomfort.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: is A YOUNG GIRL in the back seat of a station wagon. She plays with a Barbie, shows it toward CAMERA at the people

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone SHOUTS, high-pitched but distorted in a dream-lik fashion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry, watch out--!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The young girl's eyes move up from her Barbie toward the front of the car--slow, too slow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EVERYTHING SPEEDS UP, the frame shaking like an epileptic suddenly got hold of the camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only a half-second has passed, but the young girl is now lying sideways on the back seat and her forehead is smear with blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sits up slowly, dazed. Whatever she sees in the front seat disturbs her. Her lip begins to shake, tears welling her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something pops into her peripheral vision. She turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CLOWN has appeared in the window next to her. He SHOUTS something unintelligible to her, and then RIPS HIS CLOWN OFF to reveal a bloody skull--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The little girl SCREAMS--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --and Lynn bolts upright on her bed, screaming. She stops immediately as she realizes where she is, but it takes he moment to calm down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns to the clock--it's 5:38.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She jumps up and heads for the shower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Small neighborhood diner. Wooden chairs and small tables. Lynn rushes in and spots JULIE sitting alone. She rushes to join her friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am so sorry--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (friendly ribbing) Sure, whatever it is is so important that you don't want to tell me on the phone, but it's not so important you can't be-- (checks watch) --a half hour late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I fell asleep--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing at an empty plate) Look! I finished all the chicken fingers. I'm going to have to go to the bathroom and make myself throw up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn smirks at her friend and sits down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need a drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She motions for the waitress and orders a glass of red wi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So spill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (swallows, takes a breath) I'm getting a divorce, Julie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sees that Lynn's not kidding and her smiles lowers li a draw-bridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Since when?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Things have been bad for...about a year now. I guess things have never been that great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well...I just...why didn't you tell me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know...you're--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't even. I'm your friend first. Manager second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought we could work it out. Bert kept making promises and I kept waiting for him to keep them. Guess what I just found out. (doesn't give her a chance) His ex-wife's name is still on the deed to the house. The house I'm living in. He said as soon as I sold my house and moved in, he'd have it taken off. And you know how I found out her name's still on it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The internet. I had to find out on the goddamn internet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She realizes her voice has started to rise in volume, so takes a sip of her recently-delivered wine, and calms her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know if that was the final straw. It was everything. Julie, I don't know anything about him. I don't know how much money he makes because he didn't want us to have a joint checking account. He always says he's working late at night but he won't give me a number to call other than his cel phone. And that place...it gives me the creeps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a sanitarium. They do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs, moot point) I told him I was leaving and that I was taking Nicky. He hit me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie is shocked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He...hit you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods) I was packing some things. I said I was taking Nicky and I'd be filing for a divorce. He hit me in the back of the head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you call the police?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I just wanted to get out of there. That was a month ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You separated a month ago and didn't tell me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't want to bother you, what with all the stuff you've already got on your plate...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stops as she sees the look on Julie's face; How Ridiculous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what are you going to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get the divorce. Once I get full custody of Nicky, I'll start trying to reassemble what's left of my life. In California.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to move?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told Phillip yesterday. I didn't tell him why.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd he take it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was shocked, you know, at first. But he was very supportive as always.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie pulls out her cel phone and starts dialing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, the first thing I'm going to do is cancel the exhibit tomorrow night--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nononononono, please Julie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie reluctantly hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've worked so hard, and to tell you the truth, it'll be good to meet some new people. Take my mind off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn. We'll just postpone it. I don't think it's a good idea for you to be doing an exhibit when you've got this much on your mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll be good. No, great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure? Really sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you staying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A friend of mine is out of the country for a couple months. She said I could stay at her house until I find someplace of my own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Nicholas?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every other day. The lawyers had a temporary agreement drawn up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In this state, you'll have no trouble getting sole custody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods) I'm not worried about that. It's just...this can't be my life, Julie. I can't be a divorced mother. I just, I can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People change, Lynn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wistful) I don't think I ever really knew him in the first place...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The moon casts a faint light through the window. Lynn is asleep in her bed, this time without the nightmares.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: looks down upon her, and for a moment there's the impress that someone is in the bedroom standing over her. But the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOVE slowly across the bed toward the window, passing the nightlight plugged into the wall panel, right up to the window and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: into the dark night. We get a nice bird's eye view of the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pools of black shadow lie everywhere. The houses along th street are all dark grey shapes set against a starless sk Each house appears very middle-class suburban.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All is quiet. Still.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Across the street from Lynn's, SOMETHING MOVES FROM UNDER SHADOW OF A TREE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still hidden in the darkness under the leaves, it's impossible to tell what it is. Then THE CLOWN moves into light and we can see he's got some sort of bag in his han The streetlight above catches him in total silhouette, so it's impossible to tell much about him. And yet, there's something definitely sinister about him. it the peculiar sight of a clown standing in a deserted street in the dead of night? Or something else...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The clown scans the houses across the street and his gaze stops at the house two doors up from Lynn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns to look directly at Lynn's house, and makes a shrugging motion, very much like, "What can I do? My hand are tied."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He moves across the street, taking a new grip on whatever in the bag, and the bag falls into the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He holds a giant axe. Even in the dim light, the silver a blade gleams like mercury.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silently, the house awaits his entrance. Taking his time, moves toward the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn rushes out of her house, clearly late for something. stops in confusion as she sees five cop cars and an ambul in front of the house two doors down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A good bunch of the neighbors--moms and kids--stand about groups, pointing and asking questions. Lynn goes over to neighbor, GALE, a chubby motherly type who's shaking her without realizing it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me...I'm house-sitting for Margaret. Could you tell me what's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tsks) Oh it's just awful. If we're not safe here, where on earth can we possibly move to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She tsks again, but otherwise isn't forthcoming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know what happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Olsons. All of them. Killed while they slept.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Killed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Butchered, from what I hear. (off Lynn's look) I know. How could something like that happen here? While we slept? This is a nice neighborhood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My god...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She breaks it off and shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DETECTIVE PETERS, a young guy who looks more like a rock incognito, wanders over with a pad of paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morning folks. You all know the Olsons?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. (flashes the badge) Detective Peters. Homicide, of course. Either of you happen to hear or see anything unusual last night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why yes. (Peters is interested) There was a carfull of raving psychopaths parked in front of the house about midnight, but I figured if we left them alone, they'd go away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Detective Peters is put off by the sarcasm coming from someone who appears so motherly. He looks to Lynn, who sm uncomfortably.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maam. I need to know if you saw anything out of the ordinary last night, or heard anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you think I'd have called the police in that case?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe. Maybe not. It might not have struck you as strange at the time, but maybe now, with what's happened...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What exactly happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not particularly sympathetic) Your neighbors have been murdered. I can't tell you any more than that right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands them both a card.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If something comes to you, give me a ring huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's all? That's all the questions you're going to ask?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh hey. Sorry. Did either of you happen to kill the Olsons?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gale is not amused. Lynn's watching them carry a bodybag a stretcher out of the Olsons' house. Something about the sight has trapped her gaze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (didn't really need an answer anyway) Okay. Thanks. One of my guys will be over to take your names.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Detective? I'm sorry, I'm already late. (she digs in her purse and pulls out a card) This has my name and cel phone number on it. I'm...house sitting here for the next couple of weeks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at the card) An artist, huh? You don't much look like an artist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Says the rock-star detective.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peters spares her a glance, but ignores her. The way Lynn stumbled over the half-lie seems to have caught the detective's attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long you been...house sitting?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About four, no, five nights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods his head) I may have to come by later and ask you a few questions, Miss... (checks the card again) Blodgett.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, I understand. (beat) Oh, no! I'm sorry, I've got an exhibit tonight, so I won't be back at all today. Tomorrow should be fine though.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you leave her alone? Do you think she did it? Is that what your keen detective mind is telling you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The detective turns a bemused smile on Gale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. You're Miss Cleaver on the outside, but the inside's a real bitch, ain't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ex-cuse me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess I'm not so good with the sarcastic reh-par-tee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stumbles over the word like it's too hard to wrap his tongue around, but there's a quiet intelligence in his ey An intelligence that just filed Gale under "B" for bitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wanders off shaking his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His superior's going to hear about this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rushing off) Well, it was nice meeting you, I'm really really late now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calls after her) I'm Gale. Gale Wroten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn waves back without looking and hightails it to the c

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gallery looks new. Shiny hardwood floors. Small rooms showcase paintings on the wall, with new wave furniture awaiting the pretentious ass of some wannabe art critic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn rushes in. AMANDA, 23, steps out with a clipboard. S cute in a mousy, Lisa Loeb kind of way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn, hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry I'm late. You'll never believe the morning I'm having.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No worries. Everything's going pretty hokay. OOPS still hasn't delivered two of the pieces, but everything else is here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil around?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As if he heard, PHILLIP REID rounds the corner. He's kind faced, late thirties, dressed in an old-fashioned brown suit-and-vest. He's got the makings of a slight gut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn, some of these new pieces are amazing! You've been doing great work lately. Fabulous stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Phil. And thank you so much for this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's my pleasure. (takes on an aristocratic air) You know how prestigious it is to once again be showcasing the great Lynn Blodgett at my gallery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If Picasso were still alive, I'd turn him down to get you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ass kisser.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, thanks. It means a lot to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think? Should we expect a crowd tonight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you'll be pleasantly surprised...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On Lynn's questioning look...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Same place, plus a hundred people. No one speaks loud. It all QUIET MURMURS over wine or mixed drinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn's standing against a back wall with Amanda. She look dazed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quiet) How...on earth...did you get all these people here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WWW dot I hate clowns dot com. I posted it on their message board.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But...if they hate clowns, why would they come?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a love-hate thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn shakes her head; she doesn't understand, but who's complaining?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She touches Amanda's arm to signal that she's moving. She begins to weave aimlessly among the people, pausing just enough to catch whether they like her stuff or not. Most to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: not as crowded as the main room. A COUPLE murmurs about t painting in front of them, while across the room is TUCK, He's dark-skinned Latino, dressed like a model. He's star deeply at one of Lynn's clown paintings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sidles up, trying to be sly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (spares her a quick look, then back to the painting) I'm not an art critic or anything...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods, then back to the painting) It's okay. I don't know what the clown fetish is all about--I think the artist has issues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn smiles. Not what she expected to hear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (good-natured) Oh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well...they're clowns, for chrissakes. But hers are all so...scary.  Did you see the one where you walk in? I think I remember that one from Stephen King's It.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn smiles. She's looking forward to embarrassing him wh she introduces herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you're no art critic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Tucker Flynn. My friends call me Tuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He extends his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --Blodgett, I know. (mischievous smile) I saw your picture in the program.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles and reappraises him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't want to blow your cover. Not right away anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what do you really think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're good. I mean...they're great. (the smile returns) You've still got issues, but...I think they're phenomenal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She can tell he's sincere about his appreciation. She's touched.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. You from the web site?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Web site?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, nothing. What made you stop by tonight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the best gallery in Baltimore. I've bought a couple of pieces here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything of mine?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Honestly, I never noticed your stuff before, but I'll definitely be keeping my eye out now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are serious looks going on between them, a quick chemistry that seems to be catching Lynn off guard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well...I hope you have a good time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She starts to move off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. You wanna-- (shrugs) --maybe go out and get a drink later?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is she searching for an excuse or thinking about acceptin She's married, she can't be going out on dates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just a bad time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He smiles his understanding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. No problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns to move off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How 'bout tomorrow?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's complicated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm married.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sudden understanding) Ooooh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, I'm separated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (no problem then) Oh. Great. I mean, not great like I'm happy about it--- (realizes he's screwing up) Hi. I'm Tuck. I'll be right back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He heads over to the nearest tuxedo's waiter and grabs a champagne glass. He holds it up to toast Lynn, then DOWNS in one swallows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then he grabs two others off the tray and returns to Lynn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought if it didn't cost too much, I could get a guided tour of your work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn smiles at his persistance. There's something immatur endearing about him. His smile is contagious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes the drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could probably put it on your tab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tuck's glad she's going along for the ride. He steps up t the painting in front of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take this one. I notice that this clown seems to be in a lot of your paintings. What's the significance?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The more astute viewers will recognize the clown as the o from the dream in the beginning. In the painting, he's staring out at us with a look of sinister intent. He's in stark white hallway with strange objects on the wall. She stares at it intently, as if she's never seen it befo as if she's falling into it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An excited Amanda pops up behind her, saving her from answering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boss. The mayor is here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mayor? Of the city?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, of Sesame Street. (notices Tuck) Who's the hunk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn's still shocked about the mayor thing, but not so mu that she can't be embarrassed too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. Tuck, this is my number one cheerleader, Amanda. She created my web site and does all my other promotion for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tuck smiles at her ga-ga expression.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice to meet you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um hmmm. I'd like to shake my bon bons all over your--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amanda. Go tell Phillip I'll be right over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gives Tuck one last lascivious look, and then she's o

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry about that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's flattering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess I should go say hi to the mayor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he really here, or is that just a ploy you two use to impress people?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think he's really here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Impressive. Can I get your autograph later?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. Hang around. I'll be back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gives him a fleeting smile and walks away. As soon as back is turned to him, she makes a face. What the hell is doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then her expression turns to dismayed shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BERT, her soon-to-be ex-husband, rounds the corner, a win glass in hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn! There you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quiet) What the hell are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? What's the matter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's watching Nicky?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's in great hands, don't worry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So why are you here, Bert?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I came to see your new exhibit, of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bert. What the hell is wrong with you? We're not friends. (as if he's forgotten) You filed for divorce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only because you were going to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not doing this here. Please leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't get all apoplectic on me. I didn't realize you'd get so upset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why wouldn't I? This is an important night for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right. I'll go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes a final sip of his drink before putting it down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll call you later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's gone before he can see the look of disgust that cros Lynn's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes a calming breath before she goes looking for th mayor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd is mostly gone. Lynn's walking through room aft room. She's looking for Tuck, but trying not to act like

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Room after room(and blank spaces reveal that the gallery successful in moving some of her paintings) and no Tuck. She's starting to get discouraged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She comes back around to the front counter and there he i talking with Phil. Lynn suppresses a smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here she comes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I get that autograph now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He lifts something from the counter that was hidden behin his body. It's one of Lynn's paintings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But...that's...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your new admirer just purchased your most expensive piece, my dear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's eight thousand dollars...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And worth every penny. When it's worth two-hundred grand, you'll beg to buy it back. (to Phillip) Go ahead and wrap it up. I'll get her to autograph it once it's hanging up in my house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phillip doesn't get it for a moment. Then he sees the blu on Lynn's cheek. He gets it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Oh...of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He begins wrapping as Lynn and Tuck exchange looks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you mind me asking what you do, Tuck?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wanna see?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (playful flirting) I think that would depend on what it is you do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just, uh, I've got to get some tape from the other room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clearly uncomfortable with their flirting, he goes into another room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seriously. You want to see what I do, my office isn't very far away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. But only because you just paid my rent for three months. (louder toward the other room) Phillip, I'll be back soon. I'm going to see Mr. Flynn's office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tuck escorts Lynn outside and opens the passenger door of Porsche. He shuts the door after she pulls her legs in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: in the shadows of an alley stands a man. He watches as Tu gets in the Porsche, starts it and drives away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As it exits the scene, the man steps forward to watch its progress. We see it's Bert, a menacing scowl on his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tuck lets Lynn into the office. She takes a look around a goes to the alarm and turns it off. The office is very ni Clean, well-organized, tastefully decorated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is my office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's big. She walks down the hall, Tuck following behind indulging her whim to lead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So...what do you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at the pictures.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's been walking by the pictures on the wall, but now s stops to take a better look. The pictures seem to be of elaborate roller coasters at various theme parks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I still don't get it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My company designs roller coasters. Disney, King's Dominion, Busch Gardens, you name it. I've got a coaster there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn's impressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How old are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Old enough to pick touch football over tackle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you want to tell me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How old are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) Touche.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's peering close to one picture. It shows some crazy sumbitch standing on the highest point of a tall roller coaster, no car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks closer. It's a far off shot, but it sure looks it could be him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every time they finish a new coaster of mine, I like to stand at the highest point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're out of your mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs) I'm a thrill seeker, what can I say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The playful smile never leaves his face. She's clearly am at the guts it takes to do what he does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tuck leans in close over her shoulder as she stares at another picture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Impressed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's not spooked by how close he is. She doesn't want to on that she's impressed though.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't really like roller coasters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's non-plussed. He moves past her down the hall toward exit door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you feel about...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He opens the door and flicks on the light. It's a giant g room. A pool table in the center. A twenty foot shufflebo game to the side. A big screen TV in the corner with a so in front of it. A refrigerator, the works.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...shuffleboard?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She follows him into the room. It's getting harder and ha to hide being impressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I get you a beer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's at the fridge. Lynn has a moment. Put a halt to it r now, before it all gets out of hand. The reasons are many the middle of a divorce, Tuck is younger than she is, she got a kid. She doesn't even really know this guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as he's getting them) So how'd you get set up at the gallery?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Phillip owns it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seems awfully young to own an art gallery, doesn't he? I picture gallery owners as, you know, over fifty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He inherited it when his parents died. (sheepish) It seems funny now, but I actually met him...on the internet. An art forum. When he found out I was in the same city, and a painter...he offered to take a look at my stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess he liked it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods) We've had a bunch of showings, but none went like tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a second she looks like she thinks she shouldn't have said that. She breaks eye contact, but quickly looks back smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So how about a game of pool?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tuck locks up the office behind them as they leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not to sound sexist, but for a girl, you're pretty good at pool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not to sound sexist?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, that's why I prefaced it that way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From around a bush steps a MUGGER. He's mean-faced and al All business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gimme your money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tuck moves protectively in front of Lynn. The mugger's no intimidated, more interested in Lynn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gimme the purse and there won't be no trouble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tuck eyes the mugger for a moment, then holds his hand ou Lynn. She gives him the purse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tosses it to the mugger, who catches it in his knifele hand. The mugger reaches in, pulls out the wallet and poc it. He smiles a little more confidently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What else she got?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got the money. Get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you best run off, loverboy. I'll see her home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take the easy score. It's all downhill from here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mugger edges in. Tuck pushes Lynn back farther.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (never taking his eyes off the mugger) When you get the chance Lynn, throw a rock at my office window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mugger rushes. He feints and slashes across Tuck's stomach. Tuck jumps back, but there's a rip across his sh now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holding the knife up, the mugger admires the thin red coa now along one side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wanna reconsider, loverboy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing from Tuck. Still riveted on the mugger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mugger takes two steps and jabs the knife. Tuck steps the side, grabs the mugger's hand and jams an elbow into side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The instant Tuck grabs the mugger's arm, LYNN HURLS HER KEYCHAIN, five pounds of keys, at the office door. It doe shatter the window, but spider-web cracks appear and a LO ALARM BEGINS GOING OFF inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When Tuck elbows the mugger, he drops the knife. Tuck use his weight to whirl the mugger away from him, causing him tumble off balance and fall. A METALLIC CLATTER as a gun falls out of the mugger's waistband.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mugger snatches the gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Run!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn and Tuck run off toward the end of the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mugger briefly points his gun at the fleeing couple, something keeps him from firing. He's pissed. He spares o irritated glance toward where the alarm is WAILING, and h runs off in the other direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tuck's car pulls up in front of the house Lynn's staying Lynn, exhausted, doesn't move to open the door right away She stares at the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure you're all right? I can take you to a friend's house...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm okay. You're the one who got stabbed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slashed, not stabbed. I've done worse shaving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn nods absently as if she's not even listening. She reaches for the door handle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well...good night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs her arm gently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll call you tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She barely nods, gets out of the car and walks to her hou Tuck waits until she's in the house before he pulls away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn leans back against the front door and closes her eye Exhausted. With the mugging on top of her exhibit, it's j too much. She's ready to drop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She trudges into the kitchen and pours herself a glass of wine. The PHONE RINGS. She spares a look at the clock--pretty late for a call--a picks up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind her, something outside moves past the kitchen wind

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phillip? What are you doing up this late?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A non-rhythmic tapping can be heard coming from somewhere the other room. Like a branch against a window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've had me worried sick. I've called ten times since eleven o'clock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But...why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You leave the exhibit with some strange man you don't even know, and you wonder why I'm worrying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right. I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where have you been all this time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn notices the tapping. She moves into the television r The tapping seems to be coming from outside the sliding g door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Long story. Long long story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She can't see anything outside the window, it's so dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll never believe what happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She flicks on the lightswitch next to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The clown stands there revealed in the light. Like Lynn's worst nightmare, like the clown in the painting Tuck poin out, the one that Lynn paints often, the one from her dre His pupil-less eyes, however, are black as night. The soulless eyes of a shark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's staring right at Lynn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The clown cocks his head and leans closer, his breath fog the glass. Lynn faints, the phone dropping uselessly to t rug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a rumble, the sliding glass door opens to the clown' pull. He steps inside the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn? Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the BLACK comes voices. Echoes, distant and distorte

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (coming into focus) Can you hear me? Miss Blodgett, can you open your eyes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as she opens her eyes. Someone's leaning over her waving something under her nose. It's a MEDIC.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You with me now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sits up with his help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you feel okay? Does anything hurt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you hit your head when you fell?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn sees there's a COP standing behind the medic listeni His presence distracts her for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh...no. I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want to go to the hospital?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I'm all right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The medic nods and begins to pack up his things as Lynn m to a chair. The cop steps forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I-- (the remembrance floods back) --there was someone standing outside my back door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He points to the sliding glass door which is open about t inches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was open when we got here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn's eyes widen. It was open? It--the clown--came into house?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll search the house. I don't think anyone else is here though.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you know to come?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A friend of yours called. Said he was talking to you on the phone and it sounded like you collapsed. Can you describe the guy that was outside your door?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was dressed like a clown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? A what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a TAP on the front screen door. They look to see Detective Peters letting himself in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Lynn) 'Scuse me a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He intercepts Peters before he can make it over. There's HUSHED CONVERSATION between them ending in a questioning glance to the cop, who shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Detective Peters comes over and sits down across from Lyn

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you ever sleep?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not so much. You say you saw someone outside?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Right outside the glass when I turned on the light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And was he black or white?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was a clown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A clown?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was a clown standing outside your window at one a.m.?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (knowing how it sounds) Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was he lost? Wandered away from Barnum & Bailey's and got trapped in suburbia?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She says nothing, just glares back at him. He purses his thoughtfully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This a P.R. stunt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confused) What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what you do, Miss Blodgett. (off of her "so what?" look) You paint pictures. Of clowns. This some kind of publicity stunt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does it look like a publicity stunt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. But looks can be deceiving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (getting mad) That's great. How profound. I'd like you to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No need to be rude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cop catches his eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The house is all clear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peters nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just saying, if this is some stunt, it's a serious crime to call the police.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't call the police.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, I know. Your friend did. The guy that owns a gallery full of your clown paintings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stands up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be talking to you soon. I've got some other questions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn doesn't say anything. She follows them to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn shuts the door without a word. She stands there, the thoughts running wild through her exhausted head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn walks in, holding hands with her son NICHOLAS, aka Nicky. He's about five years old.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phillip, Amanda, and MR. PARRISH turn from one of Lynn's paintings toward her. Mr. Parrish is a distinguished olde man, dressed very well and holding a cane, though he does appear to need it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey...what's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you ever been spanked by a clown, Miss Blodgett?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn doesn't know whether to laugh or be offended.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Parrish hands her a photograph. In the photo is a clo mugging for the camera with a bunch of kids at a birthday party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My father. He used to be a clown for neighborhood birthday parties. A very strange thing. This man who brings joy and smiles to everyone around him...is also the man who comes home and spanks you...hits you with his hand or his belt. Not happy to do it, mind you, but doing his duty as a father punishing a son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn's listening patiently, but can't see where he's goin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You paint magnificently. I don't like the ones with the frightening clowns though. I don't know why you waste your time with those. But the ones like this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He points to the one they were all admiring when Lynn cam in. The clown in the painting gazes sadly on the wilted flower in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Incredible. Perfect. His expression...I want you to capture that for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Mr...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parrish. Endle Parrish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Mr. Parrish, I don't know what you're talking about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to paint a picture of my father. I want you to show me a clown saddened that he has to spank his son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn's expression says it all. How strange. Lynn looks to Phillip or Amanda for support. Neither says anything, but they're smiling. Like something else is coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Parrish, I'm sorry but I don't do commission pieces. I'm not even sure I could--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten thousand dollars. Cash if you'd like.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's speechless for a moment. Even Phillip and Amanda ar shocked. They knew the guy was loaded, but that's more th even they expected.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't, I mean, I could sell you that one for a lot less.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. It has to look like my father. I want an original painting of my father and I need it in three days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's just impossible. I can recommend a number of excellent painters--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. It must be you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, I can't do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty thousand dollars. That's my final offer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't understand--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn, could we speak to you for a moment?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Amanda regarding Nick) Can you keep an eye on him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amanda nods. Nicky's happy playing with his action figure a bench.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phillip pulls her into the other room, leaving Mr. Parris gaze at her paintings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't, Phillip. I don't have the time right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make the time. You can't be too busy for that kind of money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am. I'm getting divorced. That's why I'm going to move. Get away, get a new start.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't act surprised. Either that, or he doesn't thin matters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got to think this through, Lynn. Can you imagine what this is going to do for your other paintings? For your reputation? Once people hear Mr. Parrish paid twenty thousand for one of your paintings, it will open the flood gates. You won't be consigned to showing your paintings in my gallery...you'll be all over the country.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn's starting to see the picture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure I can do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course you can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's not so sure. She gives him one more unsure look bef going back into the other room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll do it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't promise you I'll get it done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He ignores her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (handing her the photo again) Excellent. My phone number is on the back. Call me when you've finished and let me know how you'd like the payment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes it. Mr. Parrish hangs the cane on the crook of arm, and if he had a hat, he'd probably doff it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He swaggers out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in awe) Twenty thousand dollars...that'll buy a lot of bandwidth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neither Phillip nor Lynn know what she's talking about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tres geek, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened last night? I called the police but wouldn't tell me anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I don't even know where to start.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (totally in the dark) What? What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll never believe it...get me some coffee and I'll tell you about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The backyard of a run-down house. Concrete stairs lead do the back to a basement door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A noise. Like a MUFFLED SHOUT followed by a dull THWACK. coming from inside the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The basement is dark and bare, undecorated cinderblock wa The concrete floor is uncarpeted. A thin mattress sits in corner surrounded by opened soda cans and other trash. Th windows are covered so that the only light is from a bulb the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A simple wooden table stands in the center of the room, a answering machine sitting on top of it. Next to the table a wooden stump.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The clown, breathing heavily, holds an axe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No warning. He swings the axe into the stump as hard as h can, YELLING like a savage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GEEEEEEEEEEEEHHHHHT!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls the axe out, mumbling as he exhales from the eff

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again he swings the axe, again the YELL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GET!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pulls it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over and over again, reciting the litany, a cruel smile o his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn and her friends have retired to the more comfortable reception area. Nick has his action figures battling underneath the magazine table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The police took our statements, but it didn't seem like they thought they'd catch him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a really nice area. I can't believe someone mugged you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened when I called you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn has an internal debate. She decides to spare herself embarrassment of the clown story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. I guess it all just caught up to me. I must have passed out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You passed out? What's that like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It felt a lot like hitting the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need to take it easy, Lynn. And I don't think that includes leaving with strange men at night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that you, dad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's right. You should stay away from that guy. (beat) Give me his phone number and I'll pass him the message.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn smirks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway. I have to get going to the mediation. You're sure you're all right with watching Nicky for an hour?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not a problem. I don't have class until four.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. Thanks a lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't thank me. I'm billing you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What exactly is supposed to happen at this mediation?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs) I'm not sure. I think we have to sit down and decide who gets what, and what his visitation rights are going to be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sterile meeting room with a lacquered table and office chairs. There's a sweating metal pitcher of water at the center of the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you out of your fucking mind?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn and her lawyer MARTY are on one side, Bert and his lawyer OSBOURNE across from them. The MEDIATOR, a man wit wooden face, sits at the head of the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mind the language please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Osbourne's a no-nonsense older man and looks like he's accustomed to taking apart multi-million dollar corporati before breakfast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what we want. Sole custody of Nicholas. Half of the ownership of every painting you've created since you married, or half the price if you've sold them already. You can keep your car. Bert won't ask for any palimony, but you'll have to pay child support.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn looks at Marty in disbelief, then back at Bert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can kiss my ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Blodgett, that's not helpful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And please direct your comments to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? Is he too chickenshit to talk to me? (shakes her head) I can't believe I'm hearing this. Marty?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marty seems like more of your public defender type attorn

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not going to fly, guys. Lynn gets sole custody. Full alimony and child support. Bert can keep his house--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The house was his before the marriage. It's not in her name at all. Our terms aren't negotiable, Marty. Your client has no home--very unstable for the child. If she tries to buy one before the divorce goes through, we'll pursue half of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Bert) Oh my God...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Osbourne tries a sympathetic smile and fails.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Marty) You don't want to play hardball with me. I'm short stop in the majors, and you couldn't play outfield in the minors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marty knows he's outclassed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We just want a fair deal, Osbourne. That's all we're looking for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're offering you a fair deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wants her to pay child support? He's a doctor, for godsakes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's been unemployed for over six months.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? What's he been doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not your business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not my business? He's still my husband, you son of a bitch. Where has he been going everyday?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, Miss--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! I want an answer. Where the hell has my husband been going every day for the past six months if he wasn't going to work?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, let's call it a day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn slams her hand on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullshit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marty touches her arm and raises his eyebrows to let her she's getting out of line. She takes a moment to calm dow

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's meet Monday after everyone's had a chance to cool down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (before Lynn can speak) Sounds good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches across to shake Osbourne's hand, but Osbourne nods and begins packing his papers into his briefcase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll fax our terms to your office. You do have a fax machine?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Osbourne nods and guides Bert out of the office. Neither Lynn's smoldering gaze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really stuck it to him, Marty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's surprised by her attack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn doesn't respond. She fights back tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not losing Nicholas. I can't lose him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll be all right. We'll get him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She doesn't look reassured.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the dark basement again. Same table. Same answering machine on the table, but the red light is blinking now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The clown stands in front of the table staring at the lig The red casts a dull reflection in his black eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pushes the button. The voice that issues from the mach is deep and electronically altered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to get better, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The clown nods imperceptibly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are getting better. Not much longer and you'll be cured. But first...take the van.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The murder van...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a pause as the voice seems to consider this. Is i answering machine or some kind of intercom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do not kill her. Follow her. Frighten her. Make her doubt her own sanity. But do not harm her...yet. Let no one else see you. Go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The clown turns and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn walks in, her cel phone to her ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not kidding you. He's going for full custody, Julie. He wants me to pay him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That bastard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, I feel like I'm having a nervous breakdown. I'm telling you...there was a clown outside my door last night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said that. You were probably just exhausted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel like I'm living in a nightmare, Julie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just take some deep breaths. So what are you going to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to paint that picture for Mr. Parrish. Then I'm going to use that money to hire the best attorney in town to kick his lawyer's ass!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That a girl!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I got someone calling on the other line, could be my lawyer. Can I call you back later?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure thing. Talk to you soon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye. (clicks a button) Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn. It's Tuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn smiles. Even with the events of the day, Tuck can br a smile to her face. She's got it bad for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. How are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was gonna ask you the same thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm okay. I mean, about last night. It's just, well there's other stuff--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wanna go get a bite to eat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's tempted, but there's so much to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like to, but--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a KNOCK on the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She goes to the door and opens it. Tuck's standing there, cel phone to his ear. He's got his mischievous smile in p

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Hey Lynn, can I call you back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn smiles and plays his game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both hang up. Lynn opens the screen door for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I was thinking...the circus is in town and if you wanted to go see some friendly clowns for once...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That idea doesn't thrill Lynn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you so afraid of clowns?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not afraid of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am not. Just because I paint them--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just because you paint scary clowns. Only scary clowns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn walks away, picks her mail off the table and busies herself sorting it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That doesn't mean I'm scared of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does it mean then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That stumps Lynn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay. There's even a word for it. Coulrophobia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coulrophobia?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fear of clowns. Lot of people have it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not smart enough to make up a word like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what are you afraid of?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes a moment. A playful smile on his face. Weighing moment; to tell the truth or lie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence. Being alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's still smiling. But something in his eyes is daring h to understand his words.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lots of people feel that way. So how could you possibly be alone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Want to do something strange?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a loaded question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You like to take pictures?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. I do a lot of photo- referencing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grab your camera. Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again, she knows she shouldn't be doing it. There's somet about him that draws her though. Like a moth to the flame

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Just let me call Amanda first...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Today, Tuck has his motorcycle, a sleek black machine tha looks built for speed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perfectly safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands her a helmet. He hops on and helps her mount the bike behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts the motorcycle and ROARS off, Lynn gripping him tightly around the waist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind them, a van with tinted-black windows starts up an pulls out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tuck pulls his cycle into a cul-de-sac off of the main ro A high fence runs the entire length of the road, but ther a hole in it where it curves for the cul-de-sac. He helps Lynn off and stacks the helmets on the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leads her to the hole and helps her climb through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once through, they're in a wooded area. Lots of trees and and overgrowth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tuck takes her hand and leads her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They emerge from the woods into a huge clear area. Everyw you look is the remnants of what used to be a theme park devoted to fairy tales.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A plastic statue of Jack(no sign of Jill) lies on the gro covered by weeds. A tall beanstalk like the one Jack migh have climbed(had his been made of metal) creeps up to the but doesn't go as far as it used to. A castle that was on pristine is falling to ruin and ivy threatens to pull dow its every wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was called The Land Of Myth. They closed it down about fifteen years ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God...I've been here. As a kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me too. It was popular for a while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they talk, they're walking through what's left of the displays. Lynn begins taking pictures.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kind of creepy now, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell you the truth, I thought it was kind of creepy back then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something about it gave me the willies. But now, to see it like this...why did they leave everything here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't know. Maybe it was hard to move. Maybe no one wanted it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She keeps snapping pics.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll have to compare pictures sometime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You take pictures?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yep. I took a lot of photography classes in college.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish I'd brought some black and white film.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay, you can make them black and white with a computer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. You can do just about anything with a computer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is movement behind them as the clown peers from aro one of the exhibits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn says nothing. She's mulling over something in her mi Tuck senses it and gives her time, just keeps checking ou all the relics.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen. I have to level with you. My life is kind of a train wreck right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well...what are we doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs) Getting to know each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tuck's playing stupid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean, why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on. I'm attracted to you and I think you're attracted to me. But this is...it's just a bad time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (playing stupid) You're attracted to me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn stops walking and smirks at him until he gives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay okay. So we're past the subtext. What's the problem?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's really complicated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said that already. You're getting divorced. What's complicated?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You asked for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give it to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's stalking them. They continue to talk, oblivious of t fact that there's a psychotic clown standing fifty feet behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He moves closer still.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --and he's trying to take my son away from me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why is the house still in his ex- wife's name? How long's it been since he was married to her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's...strange.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not even the half of it. Now I find out that he hasn't been working for the better part of a year. He'd leave the house everyday, but where he went...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See, I have a lot of stuff to work out before I can even...you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tuck only smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should have known, I mean he's a man with a cat. Single men with cats are bad news. At least, that's what the magazines say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs) Did you get enough pictures?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready to go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He nods. They head back the way they came, not seeing the clown as he circles around a structure to keep out of the sight. At one point, he's close enough to reach out and t them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn climbs on back as Tuck pulls on his driving gloves. straightens the motorcycle, and in the side mirror the cl ducks back into the bushes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She grabs him around the stomach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tuck pulls his cycle up to the curb and turns it off. She hops off just as Detective Peters gets out of his car acr the street. He looks like he's been waiting for a while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Blodgett?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn turns and sees him. Tuck does too, and something pas across his face. He can tell Peters is a cop, and there's instant friction. Like two alpha males trying to stake ou their territory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's the briefest moment where the detective waits for Lynn to introduce him to Tuck. She doesn't, so he takes t initiative.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Detective Peters, homicide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Homicide?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, that's when somebody dies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (no shit) Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was a murder yesterday a few doors down. (looks to Lynn then back to Tuck) Now Miss Blodgett is seeing clowns in her backyard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tuck shoots Lynn a questioning look. She rolls her eyes, she's tired of this guy. Tuck turns his attention back to Peters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Takes a clown to catch a clown, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He laughs like he's kidding, but Peters gets the jibe. He gives a little laugh, makes a show of examining Tuck's motorcycle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what us cops call these?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A donorcycle. Whenever there's an accident with one of them, we pick up the rider and his brain's all scrambled but the rest of him is A-okay. Perfect organ donor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tuck's not impressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what we call cops where I come from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He kick-starts the motorcycle and drives off, giving a wi to Lynn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's your friend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I help you with something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you here then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a detective. I'm...detecting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tiring of it) And what are you detecting?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I've got a funny feeling about you, Miss Blodgett.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well. Try and keep it in your pants, would you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns on her heel and heads to her door. The detectiv watches her ass the entire way but makes no attempt to fo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn's sketching from the picture of Parrish's father. Nothing fancy, just some concept sketches to get the look down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amanda's at the computer. She types something, reads, smi types something again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She tries again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn's got about ten pages of sketches next to her. Outsi her window, night has fallen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the sketch she's working on now is different. She's g colored pencils and charcoal, and is pencilling the clown seems to be obsessed with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Except now his eyes are exactly like the one she saw outs her sliding-glass door the previous night. Black, reflect a pinprick of light. She stops and takes a good look at her handiwork. Then realizes that she's put off her paying project to do more sketches of her obsession.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For God's sake...
