dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pushes it to the side and begins setting up her easel paint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amanda scrolls down, clicks. A new page pops up. Amanda begins reading, but suddenly sits back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Woah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She reads some more, scrolls down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Woah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She grabs the phone, casting a glance at the clock. Ten forty. Might be a little late with Lynn having Nicky. Disappointed, she hangs up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a click of the mouse, she opens up her email and beg writing. Just a quick note. She clicks SEND.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn paints. Broad strokes, getting a feel for the paper, the piece.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom-meeeeee!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's instantly broken out of her artist trance. She rush up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You thirsty, Nicky?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bathroom is steamy as Amanda steps out, one towel aro her body as she uses another to dry her hair. She moves into her bedroom. The head towel gets tossed on the bed. She begins blow-drying her hair with the electri hair dryer on her dresser.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Casually. No hurry. She spares a glance at herself in the mirror as she blows her hair back. She notices the curtai of her room move gently in the breeze behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She frowns and switches off the dryer. She goes to the window. She has to climb onto the bed to get to it, and immediately there's a slight TINKLING of glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind the bed lies broken glass. There doesn't seem to b any of it on the bedsheet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amanda frowns even more. What the--?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pushes the curtain out of the way. There's a hole in window about the size of a baseball. Or a fist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a moment it really doesn't bother her. Some kid must thrown something through her window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then she sees her window screen lying in the grass outsid partially bent. She pushes curtains aside to look at the of the window. It's unlocked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her eyes go wide. She's frightened but not the kind prone panic. She goes for the portable phone by her bed...it's there. Just an empty cradle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She curses almost silently. Where did she put it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes a quick look around her bedroom but doesn't see Looking at the doorway leading into the dark hallway, she seems to have a hard time swallowing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She creeps to the doorway and listens for the sounds of a intruder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence. For one moment she's in indecision. Maybe it's nothing(she forgot to lock the window), could have been a baseball. If someone broke into her house he would have f when he heard someone was home...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: she moves slowly, one hand held to the towel around her b She passes the living room(no one there) and gets to the kitchen. She quickly moves to the wall. Stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another empty cradle. No phone. That's strange. That's wrong. Sensing something in her peripheral vision she turns her head slightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The clown stands in the opening between the kitchen and dining room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amanda's startled, but only for a moment. And then, rathe then being scared, she scoffs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell are you supposed to be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The axe, which had been hanging out of sight by his leg, THWACKS into the kitchen wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That does it. Amanda runs for the front door. The clown doesn't bother pulling his axe out of the wall. He moves quickly around the other side, intercepting her before sh gets to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs for her--only gets the towel--it comes loose. A naked Amanda stumbles as the towel is jerked from her. Th clown tosses it to the side and grabs her by the hair bef she can scramble more than a few feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He drags her struggling form back into the kitchen. He gr her by the neck and SLAMS her back into the wall so her f aren't touching the ground anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's choking. Has to use both hands to keep from suffoca completely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The clown is suddenly aware of her nakedness. He runs a finger down from her shoulder to the curve of her breast. studies her like he's never seen a naked women before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She makes a desperate grab at his face, raking her nails one side of his cheek. The gashes aren't deep, but they t off some of his paint. He SLAMS her head against the wall

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Casually he tosses her to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's choking, trying to get her air back. Weakly crawlin backward away from him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wrenches the axe from the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She tries to beg--can't talk, her larynx is crushed--puts arm up. The clown takes a two handed grip on the axe. Getting rea to chop wood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He swings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn's finished a painting. Very nice, but not as clean a her paintings on display. And it's missing something...so emotion. She's looking at the photo closely then looking at the picture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you missing...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She can't figure it out and she's too tired to try. She covers the painting and goes to bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn enters from the front door. The PHONE IS RINGING. Sh rushes to get it, leaving the front door open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The phone stops ringing the moment her hand touches it. S curses silently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Knock knock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tuck's standing right outside her screen door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're probably getting sick of me, aren't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn pretends like she is, gives him a sympathetic smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now that you mention it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I called earlier...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was dropping Nicky off with his father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Well, did you want to do lunch?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At La Casa Tucker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should be painting...and do you really have a job?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on. Best food in the state.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indecision again. Again, what she wants to do beats out w she should do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right. I can spare an hour or so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gives her his winningest smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excellent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn pulls her mini-van up behind Tuck's motorcycle. The house is huge. Tuck gets off his cycle and leads her into house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn follows him in and WHISTLES appreciatively. Two spir staircases run on both sides of the foyer to the second level. Expensive art adorns the walls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying to be modest) I got a good deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not buying it) Hm-hmmm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It ain't much, but I call it home. What's your pleasure? Chinese, Italian, you name it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is your maid going to cook it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He flashes a reproachful smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have a maid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An orange cat strolls out from a side room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Tiggs, we have a guest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn sees the cat, sees Tuck squat down to pet it, and sh smiles sardonically as she remembers what she said about and cats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have a bathroom? I have to pull my foot out of my mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay. Tiggs is no ordinary cat. He's a wolf at heart. (stands up) So what would you like to see on the menu?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Surprise me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Detective Peters, OFFICER PATRICK and another cop stand a the door, having already knocked. Peters knocks again, lo and insistent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No answer. Peters turns to the cop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See if any of the windows are broken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cop heads around the side of the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into his radio) Dispatch, this is four-oh-one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go four-oh-one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need info on a three-twenty-two that happened in Queen Anne's County two nights ago. I need addresses on both victims.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Copy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Officer Patrick--behind him--clears his throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Assault and battery, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh? No, attempted robbery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's three-twenty-one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nuh-uh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did they change it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Always been three-twenty-one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peters is miffed. This is the kind of shit that ruins his

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into radio) Dispatch, this is four-oh-one again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go four-oh-one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into radio) That three-twenty-two may be a three-twenty-one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into radio) I need info on an attempted robbery. Whatever the number is. One of the victims is named Lynn Blodgett. I need the name and address of the other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Copy. Hold on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Patrick, frustrated) Fuckin' codes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tuck and Lynn sit at the table, having just finished a lu that probably should have been a dinner. Lynn leans back, patting her stomach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. I have to tell you, I'm surprised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really don't strike me as the kind of guy who can cook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ouch. (picks up his plate and hers) Do I strike you as the kind who can wash dishes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe with a dishwasher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make yourself at home while I clean up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure you don't want help?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be all right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She wanders into what passes as a living room, but is mor like a small museum. Bookshelves line one side, and a hug plush couch separates the entertainment center from it. A family of four could live in his big-screen T.V.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She peruses his books while they talk back and forth betw rooms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said you should be painting. What are you working on? Wait, let me guess: A clown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ha ha. Stick to cooking. I've got a commission piece to do. Has to be done in...well, two days now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not much time for a painting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The money's supposed to make up for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I ask what your going rate is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For this piece, I'm getting twenty thousand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ha! I told you that painting I bought from you was a steal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn's been flipping through occasional books. Tuck's interests are wide-ranging. There are a bunch of art book On a lower shelf sits a stack of magazines. Lynn sees one recognizes and pulls it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll see. I'm really not sure I can do what the guy is asking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's he asking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn flips through the magazine called "MODERN PAINTER" a sees a page which has been bent in to save the place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A picture of his father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The page opens to reveal a large photo of Lynn, followed an article about her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't sound that tough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn frowns. She was under the impression that Tuck knew nothing about her when they met. She flips to the front and notes that the magazine is mon old and has a subscription label on it with Tuck's name a address. Not a recent buy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His father was a clown and he wants him to look a certain way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She grabs another magazine out of the stack. One called " GALLERY". There are two pages folded in. The first is a painting of hers with its name(MARY'S CLOWN) and her name under it. The second page shows a picture of her with a s biography next to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now she's alarmed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I meant to ask you. You think it's strange that guy tried to mug us with a knife when he's got a gun in his coat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's doesn't want to panic. Ask him about it? Was their meeting just a chance thing, or has he been...stalking he

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe it wasn't loaded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We wouldn't have known that--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's interrupted by THE DOORBELL. Lynn hastily drops the Gallery mag on top of a pile of magazines next to the fireplace, then goes toward the front door as Tuck answer

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Detective Peters stands on the front stoop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn Blodgett here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clearly, Tuck's not pleased that Peters has stopped by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (steps into his line of sight) What is it, detective?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could you come with me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to talk to you, Miss Blodgett. Let's go back to your house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since Peters is ignoring him, Tuck physically steps betwe Peters and Lynn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to step out of the way?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to talk to my lawyer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn puts a hand on his arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay. (to Peters) I take it this is important?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tuck doesn't seem to notice that Lynn's a bit relieved to getting away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for a great lunch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My pleasure. Give me a call later, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Detective Peters sees her to her car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you tell me what's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicholas--my son--nothing's--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not about your son. Please follow me back to your house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He heads to his car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn and the detective enter. As they shut the door we ca see Officer Patrick right outside the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit down. Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He escorts her into the living room and gets her to sit o the couch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amanda Greene was murdered last night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her head jerks back like she was punched.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, I know she worked for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's a strong woman. Doesn't want to show her tears, so fights them back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was my friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the only thing she can get out. The tears course dow her cheeks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's more. I wish I were better with the tact, but I'm not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The scene of--where she died...I mean, it's not just that. We don't have the coroner's report yet, but I'd bet my shield that... (licks his lips, probably shouldn't say anything) ...well, I think the person that killed your friend is the same person that killed the family three doors down from you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's having a hard time dealing with it. Any of it. Amanda...dead, killed...same as the neighbors...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think it's a coincidence. I think someone is zeroing in on you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn's too surprised to speak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've already said more than I should. But there's more. I need to know I have your complete confidence, that you won't repeat what I'm about to tell you. To anyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She nods, afraid to trust her voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amanda fought back against the person. We've recovered blood and tissue from under her fingernails. And...grease paint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paint?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's glancing at her paints next to her easel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grease paint. Like you'd buy in any Halloween or costume shop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, I just, I don't understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peters take a photo out of his jacket pocket, not showing to her yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The window that he entered from...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not sure how to say it...he shrugs and hands her the photo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at it, not comprehending what she's looking at. window with a hole in it. But below that, smudged white a a red dot centered below it. Then it hits her. Her eyes w in shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stands up and moves to her sketch pad. She flips it o to the clown--her clown--that she drew the night before. holds the picture next to the sketch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's pretty obvious that if her clown were real, and he pushed his face against a window, it would leave those ma White forehead, red nose. Evil. Peering in Amanda's windo Just like he peered in her window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She holds the sketch and the photo out to Peters. He take them, but it's like he already thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I admit that I didn't take you seriously with your clown story the other night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To tell you the truth...I'd convinced myself it was some hallucination, or shock from being mugged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you have my assurance that I'm taking you deadly serious now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This what he looked like when you saw him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His eyes are black like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh. Can I have this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stands, starts backing his way to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoever this guy is...we'll get him. You need to watch yourself until we do though. I'll have someone out in front of your house at all times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn stays strong, nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll call you if I come up with anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once he's gone though, the tears flow. She weeps almost silently for her friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A car is parked under the shade of a tree. Bert's SAAB pu in next to it, but during the conversation, the person in other car can't be seen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bert rolls his window down. He tries to act like he's watching something in front of him while he talks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is taking so long?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't want to take that tone with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man's got a dangerous voice. Bert backs off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was--you were supposed to have done it by now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clearly, there's been a problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First, the guy she's been hanging out with. I could go around that. Other problem, well, it's a clown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a clown been following her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A clown?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a shrink you don't hear so good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me about this...clown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only saw him once. Your wife and her new beau went sightseeing at an abandoned amusement park. The clown followed them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did he look like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looked like a clown. Face paint. Frizzy thing around the neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bert knows something. He stares forward for a moment, debating, but doesn't address it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what's the problem?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People are getting killed all around your soon-to-be-ex. The cops are swarming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A family, couple doors down. Then last night, a girl that works for her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amanda?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever. My source in the department says they got grease paint off the window the perp came in. (on Bert's clueless look) Like clown makeup. This is gonna take more money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your choice. I'll just take what you've given me as a deposit for services rendered. Have a nice life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His car starts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait! How much more?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmmmm...psychotic clowns, cops galore. Another ten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bert winces. He's not happy about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, but that's it. I can't pay you any more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The whole make-it-look-like-a- mugging is out. Get your alibi ready, doc. They're gonna question you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heston is the "mugger" who tried to rob Lynn and Tuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll do it when the money's transferred. She's as good as dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His car pulls away. Bert watches him drive off, but his m is on something else. Something nagging at his brain like name on the tip of your tongue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn enters. All the make up in the world can't disguise fact that she's been crying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phillip's at the front desk doing paperwork. He sees her rushes over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Lynn, I'm so sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hugs her. She takes a couple of deep breaths, fights o the urge to cry again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wan smile) Yeah. When did you find out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About an hour ago. Some detective came by to ask questions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Detective Peters?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. That was him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shakes her head at his persistance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (kidding) I think he's been following me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phillip's concerned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would a detective be following you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was joking. At least, a little. He seems to pop up all the time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's strange...Oh, hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He retrieves some papers from behind the counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't show this to the detective. I hope I won't get in any trouble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amanda sent us all an email last night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn looks at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's about Mr. Parrish. His father wasn't just a clown; he was a convicted child molester. One of the children disappeared, but they could never prove he had anything to do with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The second page has some pictures.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn looks. The pictures are from the trial. One picture particular sticks out: Mr. Parrish's father sitting behin the defendant's desk with a deep look of remorse on his f

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Feeling overwhelmed, Lynn backs herself onto a bench.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, I should have waited to show you--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's all right Phillip. I have to give this to the police. Amanda sent this to us last night sometime before... (can't bring herself to say it) I have to give this to the detective.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you don't want to paint for him, I understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to. I need the money. (off his look) I have to get a new lawyer. Bert's trying to take Nicky away from me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He can't do that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He can. (overwhelmed) I just don't feel like I could paint anything right now. I've got cops in front of my house--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PHONE RINGING interrupts her. Phillip answers it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flinner Gallery. Oh, hello Mr. Flynn...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn shakes her head: She's not here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I haven't seen her today. (beat) I'll tell her you called when I see her. Bye bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that all about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (doesn't feel like going into it) I don't feel like talking to anyone right now. (occurs to her) Hey, did he ever buy anything from the gallery before?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well...I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her cel phone picks that moment to RING. She looks at the number: it's Tuck. She doesn't want to talk to him, but s doesn't want her phone to keep ringing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She puts up a finger to Phillip to give her a minute, and moves off to talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tuck's leaning against his car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, there you are. I tried to reach you at home and at the gallery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'm running around...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, is everything okay? What did that detective want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amanda, my assistant...she was murdered last night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone attacked her in her house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God...Did they catch whoever did it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there anything I can do? Do you need anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus. Why would anyone do that? Do you want me to come by--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's...listen Tuck. (deep breath) I think we uh, I need some time to deal with all this...alone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's disappointed, but hides it in his voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, I understand. I'm here for you, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You watch yourself, huh? Where are you now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm...outside the police station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Give me a call if you need anything. Anything at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. I'll talk to you soon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: to see he's been standing in front of the gallery looking Lynn's car. He knows she's lying. His expression is hard read.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: White cement steps lead down to the basement door. Bert, doing his best to be covert, creeps to the window looking into the basement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From his vantage through a crack in the curtains, he can THE CLOWN sitting in a chair. The room is very dark, but shape is there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bert creeps down the steps and tries the knob. It opens a he slips in. INSIDE, he keeps his back to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispered hiss) What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The clown's head turns slowly. He looks back to the answe machine on the table, then again to Bert. He stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doc-tor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. What are you doing, Doug?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The clown cocks his head at an angle. He talks very slow, very stilted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name is Shivers. Shivers the clown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bert's edgy and uncomfortable. The darkness is pervasive, oh yeah, there's a homicidal clown twenty feet away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right. Shivers. What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you told me. Getting better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confused) What? No. What you did--Amanda had nothing to do with getting better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A-man-da?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. The girl you killed. This, what you're doing, I thought we'd talked about it. You've got to stop this. You should come back and start therapy with me again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're...confusing me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes a step up toward Bert, who instantly recoils.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait. Just...just wait until you hear from me. I'll call you. I'll help you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help me get better?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Just wait for me. Okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The clown's breathing heavily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bert doesn't take his eyes off the clown as he opens the and backs out. The clown watches him go, then sits back d

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The phone begins RINGING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bert rushes to his car, jumps in and locks the door. He fumbles with his cel phone and dials from his phone book. BUSY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damnit! (redials, it's ringing) What the hell do you think you're doing? I thought we agreed using Doug was a bad idea. (beat) Why? Because he's nuts! Yes, that's my professional opinion! (beat) Come on Shane. This, this isn't going to work. I've got--look, this could come back and bite me on the ass. Can you come by my house tonight? Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hangs up, starts the car and drives off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn's got her easel set up in front of her while she sketches. There are a number of sketches already set out the floor, but she's not happy with them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's got the newspaper clipping of Mr. Parrish's father front of her, referencing it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Officer Patrick's sitting on the front bench reading Step King's IT. He looks up as a car passes, watches it drive then goes back to his book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's parked five houses down across the street. A canvas is on the seat next to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tuck enters, tossing his keys onto a table in the foyer. heads into the living room, picks up the remote from the table and turns to drop back into the couch--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --and he sees the Art Gallery sitting on top of the pile magazines. He goes to it, picks it up, confused. Definite not where he left it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He flips it open to the marker and Lynn's face stares out him. Then the next magazine below it with another page-ma at Lynn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts two and two together immediately. Mentally curses himself. He grabs the phone and dials Lynn's number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn paints. Pages of sketches are strewn about her. All forgotten. Her mind is now on one thing, the painting in front of her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PHONE RINGS but Lynn pays no attention. She's so focu that she probably doesn't even hear it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's immersed in the work. Paying no attention to anythi around her. In the zone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Officer Patrick zips up as he walks around from the backy where he was apparently taking a piss. A van pulls up in front of the house with PARTY-PLUS on the side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A HAPPY CLOWN gets out and walks up the sidewalk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heston leans forward, very interested in what's going on. wasn't expecting this, but maybe there'll be an opening..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: can't believe it--a clown walking up the sidewalk--he fum out his gun and points it at the clown, who doesn't notic because he's reading from a clipboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop right there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The clown's startled, just about drops his clipboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WOAH! What the hell?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get over here, get on the ground!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, okay--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NOW!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The clown lays down on the ground. Officer Patrick gets o top and handcuffs him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't do nothin', I was called out here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure you were. You got ID on you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside the suit. You gotta zip down the zipper, in my back pocket there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From around the back of the house creeps SHIVERS THE CLOW He grips the strings from a dozen floating helium balloon He sees the cop working to get the other clown's ID.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks out more confidently, coming up behind the two. cop's got the happy clown's ID out and is looking at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shivers shifts hands, releasing the balloons to reveal th he's been holding his axe, hidden by the balloons the who time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the foyer window, Tuck can be seen starting his motorcycle and PEELING off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The happy clown, looking over his shoulder back at the co the first to see Shivers. A giant axe in his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick turns just in time to see the descending axe blad It takes him in the back of the neck, almost decapitating him. His body falls onto the happy clown who starts hyperventilating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shivers spares him a look, then starts to turn toward the front door. As if he has some sixth sense though, his gaz caught on Heston's car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: has his mouth wide open. He's trying to sit very still.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy shit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The clown seems disturbed. From this distance it's hard t tell if he can see Heston, but he seems to be staring rig at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shivers turns suddenly, stalking back the way he came.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The happy clown has his eyes closed, must be going into s or something. Hyperventilating still.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heston's surprised by the sudden turn and takes a look up down the street. Doesn't see any witnesses. He reaches in his canvas bag and grabs out a cheap rubber clown mask, p it over his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He quickly pulls his car in front of Lynn's house. He get out of the car--one hand inside his jacket conceals the g from earlier--and hurries up the front walk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Past the dead cop and the pinned clown. He runs smack int the front door which surprises him by being locked. He SL his shoulder into it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn's startled from her work by the BANG against her fro door. She puts the brush down as there's another BANG.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She bolts to her feet just as the third SLAM shatters the lock and blows the door open. Heston moves in fast, kicki the door shut behind him, and stops to listen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From Lynn's POV, she saw the clown-masked intruder move p the room she's in. She's terrified, but stifles her screa The man is not in her sight now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks around for a weapon, anything, but there's noth no help at all. Heston doesn't wait long. Not hearing anything, he assume she's upstairs asleep. He quickly creeps up the stairs to her bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn didn't hear him go up the carpeted steps. Quietly sh creeps to the edge of the wall, peers around the corner. not in sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did he go to the kitchen or up the stairs? She eyes the d Ten feet away and closed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She creeps out quietly, reaching for doorknob, keeping he eyes darting back and forth between the upstairs and the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her hand's on the knob when Heston comes out from the bedroom. His eyes widen inside the mask as he sees her at door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He FIRES without aiming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bullet splinters a chunk out of the door but misses i mark. Lynn SCREAMS and runs toward the back of the house, toward the glass door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tuck pulls up on his motorcycle and gets off. He sees the dead cop, the clown pinned underneath him, and leaps off motorcycle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he runs to the house there's a GUNSHOT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heston FIRES AGAIN and rushes down the stairs after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn runs into the sliding glass door, pulls it, but it's locked, she fiddles with the lock--both ways, still won't budge--she sees the stick wedged to keep it shut, grabs i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HEY!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns, holding the stick in front of her like a sword She's terrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heston's there, made all the more menacing by his clown m

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothin' personal, lady. Just delivering a message from your husband. He says goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He raises the gun level to her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TUCK dives into Heston's back, bearing him to the ground. Heston drops the gun to keep from slamming headfirst into carpet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tuck struggles to keep control, keep Heston down, but Heston's trying to get up, get some leverage. They're grappling for control, rolling and sliding across the flo like a couple of high-school wrestlers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neither one sees Lynn pick up the gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the background RUNNING WATER can be heard. Bert pulls his shirt, then massages his trapezius like his neck is bothering him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks up at the KNOCK on his front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leaves his bedroom and heads for the front door. He lo through the peephole, sees no one, then opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no one there. There is a van with tinted windows front of his next door neighbor's house. He looks at it, it doesn't register.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He goes back inside and shuts the door, rubbing at his ac neck some more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He steps into the steaming hot water, lies back. It's a little cramped, but he doesn't seem to mind. He takes a second to let the heat soak into his muscles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then he reaches over the side of the bathtub and grabs hi book. We can see that he left the bathroom door cracked o slightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He relaxes, getting into the book. There's a CREAK from r outside the bathroom door. Bert lowers the book and looks toward it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It must be his imagination, but the door looks like it's a little farther. He goes back to reading. Turns the page

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's another creak, but this time there's something different. Without lowering the book, Bert can feel it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a pregnant moment where he looks like he's not go to lower the book and look. But he finally does. The clown stands in the bathroom doorway, the axe in hand Bert looks like he's just run into a bear and doesn't kno whether to run or play dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, hold on a minute--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The clown rushes him, jabbing the axe point viciously int Bert as he tries to get up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blood mixes into the water as the clown continues to stab stab, stab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heston jabs an elbow at Tuck's head. Tuck turns his head still takes it in the cheek hard. It's enough to let him out of Tuck's grasp. He turns to run--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --Lynn, a distant look in her eye, stands there pointing gun at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tuck stands up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lady...you don't know how to use that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Famous last words. Lynn pulls the trigger. Glass shatters behind Heston. He turns to look and sees a ruined picture featuring a bullet hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns back to her and smiles but the smile dies as he feels something on his chest. Blood is soaking his T-shir

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heston has enough time to realize he's in a direct line between the picture and the gun, then the life fades from eyes. He collapses sideways.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tuck is shocked. Lynn can't seem to get her eyes off of Heston's body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn. Give me the gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns her eyes from the dying man to Tuck. Their stra lack of depth gives Tuck cause for concern.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reassuring) Lynn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He holds his hand out. After a moment, she hands him the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Police cars are clustered in front of the house. Lynn and Tuck stand off to the side trying to stay out of the way. There's an uncomfortable distance between them that Tuck' trying to figure a way into.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey...listen, I wanted to explain about the magazines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hopes she'll say forget about it, but she doesn't. He on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been a big art fan for years, all kinds, and I first saw your art in those mags. When I heard about the showing downtown, I thought it would be neat to see some of your paintings up close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said you saw my picture in the program.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did. That's just not the only place I saw your picture. I didn't want you to flip out and think I was a stalker, which...is probably what you're thinking right about now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn's noncommittal. Detective Peters comes out of the ho and heads over to them. He pulls Lynn away from Tuck so h can talk to her privately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well. Helluva shot, Miss Blodgett. He's pretty dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remorse. I like that. It seems your husband paid that guy to kill you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a detective, you have the shittiest people skills I've ever seen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, I've taken classes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would Bert do that? He's divorcing me, he's taking everything--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll make a wild guess and say he's got a sizeable life insurance policy out on you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Oh my God...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. We found a tape recorder in Mr. Hitman's car. He'd taped a few conversations with your husband, conversations where your husband hired him to kill you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yep. Plain old greed. I guess getting the hitman to dress up as a clown must have been him being creative. Hell, it's as good a disguise as any.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he wasn't the clown I saw--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He probably changed outfits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you positive?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She thinks. That night on the porch, it happened to so fa it was dark and she fainted...she just can't be sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He had makeup on when I saw him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Probably figured out a mask was much less work. Easier to take off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's got his mind made up and he's starting to convince h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why didn't he kill me that night then? After I fainted?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe he got scared off by your friend on the phone. We'll never know for sure. (waves it off) You just take it easy. We're looking for your husband now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know where he is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We think he's on the run. No sign of him at his house. Don't worry about it, we'll get him soon. Whatever you were asking for in this divorce thing...ask for more. You'll get it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She nods, realizing the implications for her and Nicholas way will they give custody to Bert now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you have any other questions, give me a call. (hands her a card) My home numbers's on the back. Night or day, doesn't matter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He smiles reassuringly and leaves. Tuck comes over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard. I think you should try and get some sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn nods, but looks doubtful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I give you a call tomorrow? When everything's more normal again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She thinks it over, decides she wants him to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. I guess I could give you a second chance, seeing that you saved my life and all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (his smile's back) Great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gives her a quick hug, gets on his cycle, and rides of Lynn turns back toward her house and watches the cops, waiting for them to finish their work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn's in bed again, tossing and turning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sterile, white hall, infinitely long. People move in an out of our sight, all blurry, out of focus. As they clear we see a YOUNG BOY sitting on a bench.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at us sadly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dead. They're all dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stands up and points a finger at us accusingly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're all dead!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE CLOWN's face pops into view staring right at us, smil like a demon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: sits up in bed, her heart racing. Looks around, starting get her bearings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sees a clown doll sitting on her dresser that wasn't there before. Who could have put that there...? All at once, it begins to turn its head, its eyes glaring malevolent red--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: sits up in bed for real this time, looking immediately to dresser. No clown doll there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks out the window; the sun is coming up on a new d

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn, Phillip and Mr. Parrish are staring at a painting t is propped on an easel in the middle of the room. Mr. Par stares in wonder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's amazing. Simply amazing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see the painting. It's the one Lynn was working on of Parrish's father, and it captures the look he wanted, to perfection. Tears appear in his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's even better than I could have imagined. I can't thank you enough. (to Phillip) Please. Wrap it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phillip takes the painting off to wrap it. Mr. Parrish pu his checkbook out and begins writing. He finishes, signin his name with a flourish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was the final price agreed upon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty thousand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Parrish nods, he knew. He hands her the check. She ta it without looking at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll spread the word about your talent, Miss Blodgett. You have quite a future before you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Parrish walks to the front door to where Phillip is waiting with his painting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes his painting and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. Home run, Lynn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles, looking at the check.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can sure put this to-- (frowns, then blinks) Oh my God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This check is made out for a hundred thousand dollars. He gave me a hundred grand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PHONE RINGS. Phillip gets it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? Mr. Flynn?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shoots a questioning look to Lynn. She nods and reache for the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? Pretty good actually. A hundred thousand dollars good. (beat) I'll tell you later. (laughs) Thanks. Uh...well, convince me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phillip is busy in the kitchen making what looks to be an elaborate meal. He checks in one of his cabinets for nood none there. He begins to go downstairs to get some but something in h backyard catches his eye. There's someone out there stand in the shadow of a tree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phillip frowns. From his vantage it's hard to see anythin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He goes back the way he came, through his hall, into his bedroom. Looks out the back window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's got a slightly better view, but it's still not great The person almost looks like...a clown. Phillip draws bac away from the window, frowning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks back into the hall and turns into the guest room the corner of his house. One window faces the backyard wh another next to it faces the side of his house. He looks the backyard window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Has to blink once. The clown is gone. Unless...Phillip tr to peer around to see if the clown is behind the tree, bu doesn't look like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phillip leans back again and doesn't see the clown starin the side window at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns to leave as the clown raises the axe, swings it the window. On the axe crashing through glass:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tuck escorts Lynn into the theater. It's huge, covered wa to wall in advertisements for movies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice theater.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only the best for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will we be able to get popcorn?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With butter. And a Coke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He winks like, I got the hook-up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JEFF appears at the top of the stairs leading to the seco level.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Tuck! I'm about ready. You're gonna be in theater eight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. Thanks. We're gonna grab some concessions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can send Bobby down to do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, that's cool. I know where everything is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He jogs back to the projection booth, punching the code t get through the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tuck motions Lynn to follow him behind the concession boo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A thin set of concrete steps runs down to a steel door, a bathed dimly yellow by the auxillery lights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The clown makes his way slowly up the steps. The giant ax one hand. A canvas bag in his other hand, THUMP THUMPING every step.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something short and thin is inside the bag, and it's not moving. Something that looks like a small body...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bucket of popcorn sits on the counter next to the soda fountain. Tuck is filling two cups at the same time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're like an expert. If I didn't know better, I'd swear you've done that before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burger King when I was in high school. It's a lost art.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I worked at a theater when I was in high school. Didn't last two months.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They don't know what they lost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He lets off of the taps at the same time. Both sodas are identically filled. He waits until the foam goes away and finishes filling them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pops a top on them and hands her one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suddenly occurs to her) What are we seeing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was thinking some scary horror movie where you'd have to snuggle close to me, but given the past couple of days... (shrugs) I opted for a sappy love movie instead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good choice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They head toward the auditorium.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff is carrying the reel of film--it's the entire movie rolled together, and it's so big he can't even see around He slides it onto a platter and threads it through the projector.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOBBY, a pimply teen, pops out of the bathroom and shouts down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna go make sure the doors are all locked up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby disappears out the door as Jeff finishes threading film.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he stands up, movement at the far end of the projectio booth catches his eye. He squints. It's hard to tell. Small pools of light at ea projector are the only illumination. Most of the room is darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still...something's off. The shape isn't right at the far

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff makes his way slowly toward the end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's twenty feet away from the spot when the clown steps of the shadow. The only thing in his hand is the axe, but it's shadowed in the darkness behind a film platter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (jumps) Hey! (relieved for a moment) Scared the shit out of me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then he realizes--it's late at night and there's a clown his projection booth. It dawns on him: Someone's playing joke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did Bobby put you up to this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The clown takes a step toward him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She'll pay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This ain't cool, man. You can't be up here. This is--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The clown takes another step, splashing a shaft of light the axe blade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Woah. (steps back) I'll get Bobby for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes another step. The clown raises the axe. Jeff tur to run, panic growing on his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The clown hurls the axe. It spins twice and smacks solidl into the back of Jeff's head. He drops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The clown moves to him and grasps the haft of his axe. He tugs at it, pulling Jeff's head from the ground, but the doesn't come out. He has to put one foot on Jeff's head, and with a vicious yank, rips it free. He doesn't bother wiping it off as he moves toward the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The clown moves to the small window that looks down into theater. He can see Tuck and Lynn seated in the middle of auditorium.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tuck picks that moment to look back. From his vantage poi the shape is too dark behind the window for him to recogn Thinking it's Jeff, he waves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The clown backs away from the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think he's getting ready to start it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. This is a little past my bedtime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm glad you came out. I wasn't sure you would, you know, given...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods) Might be good for me to see a movie, forget it all for a couple of hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods) That's the right attitude. Who's got Nicholas?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie. She's been dying to take him for a while anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kitchen's a wreck. The table is flipped on its side, papers and a bowl of fruit are scattered on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: to the phone jack, a wire plugged into it. FOLLOWING the we see the cradle of the phone, and a spiral-cord trailin off...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...to the phone. A hand clutches it limply. We follow the hand past the bracelet up the arm to where it ends at the shoulder. The arm is no longer attached to a body, but cu cleanly at the top.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: across the floor now marred with puddles of blood to wher Julie lies butchered. Her face, other than spatters of bl is untouched, but her body is in pieces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby's testing the doors to make sure they're all locked won't open without a key, even from the inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That taken care of, he hops the concession counter and tu off the frozen drink machines. He heads through the back comes out at the rear concession entrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes a step toward the stairs, but stops and makes a sudden decision to head into the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHISTLING no particular tune, he enters a stall and unzip not bothering to shut the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The clown's boots on the tile floor don't make enough noi to alert Bobby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby's done pissing and shakes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The clown stands right behind him outside of the stall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby tucks himself back in his pants and is about to tur when the clown RAMS the axe point through his back, throw the helpless teen against the wall in front of him. Somet major's been hit; blood is running out of his chest like river.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His strength leaving, Bobby falls to one knee over the toilet. The clown JERKS the axe out of him, and without t support, Bobby collapses completely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The clown turns. Listens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tuck and Lynn are getting a little antsy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If this takes much longer, I'm gonna demand my money back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think the hold up is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tuck shrugs that he doesn't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A HOLLOW SOUND, muffled, seems to come from the entrance the auditorium.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's he doing now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The clown walks slowly into the auditorium. He's complete out of sight of Lynn and Tuck; until he rounds about the third row of seats, he'll be out of sight behind the conc wall that supports the stadium seating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (joking) I'm gonna have to speak to a manager if you don't start the movie, Jeff!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No expression from the clown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tuck is looking at Lynn when the clown rounds the first r of seats. She's looking right at the clown, and the look her face is enough to wipe the smile off of his.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The question forms on his face, but he turns to look, and sees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The clown has stopped at the foot of the first stair. He holds the bloody axe in both hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're gonna pay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tuck stands, pulling a terrified Lynn to her feet. Tuck g his soda, but keeps an eye on the clown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The clown mounts the stairway, one at a time. No hurry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tuck pushes Lynn behind him, backing her down the aisle a from the clown. By the time the clown is on the same aisl level as they are, he's at one end and they're at the oth The clown considers this. He takes a step forward. Tuck pushes Lynn down a step. The clown backs up. Tuck doesn't move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Move slowly down the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn, almost dazed, does. Instead of following, Tuck move a stair. The clown doesn't even look at him. Focused enti on Lynn, watching her like a cat about to pounce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tuck doesn't even exist to the clown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Lynn) Wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stops. The moment hangs, all three staring at one another. Lynn and the clown as if in a trance, Tuck's min racing with indecision.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RUN!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He throws his soda at the clown and runs down the stairs toward Lynn. The soda's a great throw. It gets the clown' attention, something coming at him from his peripheral vision. He bats it away with his axe, then crosses throug the aisle in pursuit of the fleeing couple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn and Tuck burst out the auditorium door. Tuck, thinki quickly, overturns the large trash can in front to block door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs her hand and pulls her toward the front doors. T smack into them and can't understand why they don't open. They're just push-lever doors, but they don't realize Bob has locked them with a key.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: has run into the auditorium door, which is jammed shut by trash can. He kicks at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: runs to the single door to the side of the main entrances tries to open it. No joy there either.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Break them!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With what? It's reinforced safety glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tuck hears the sound of the DOOR hitting the TRASHCAN as clown kicks it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs her hand and heads down the side corridor leadin back toward the theaters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: has kicked the door enough that the trash can no longer j it. He slides out and strides toward the front.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tuck and Lynn emerge through the corridor door, right bac front of the auditorium entrances. Tuck cautiously goes r back to the theater they came from.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He opens the door as wide as he can without hitting the t can, lets Lynn slide in, and he follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: stands in the lobby where Tuck and Lynn were moments befo He's listening, but there's no sound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His gaze travels from the glass doors to the concession stand. Considering. Back to the doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A table next to the concession stand has paper and pens f entering a contest. The clown goes to it, propping his bl axe on top while he grabs a sheet of paper and a pen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He begins writing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peters is in shorts, T-shirt and socks. He's putting toge a puzzle at his kitchen table. It looks to be about 10,00 pieces, but he's doing pretty good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thrill me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peters puts down the puzzle piece he's holding and goes t his computer. He clicks a couple of buttons and his email pops up, displaying the message "NEW EMAIL". It reads "BLOOD SAMPLE #4990345 DIC: PETERS". The second reads "DEPARTMENT OF JUSTICE KNOWN SEX OFFENDER DOUG RICHARDSON".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peters is getting interested now. He reads on and somethi catches his eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Under WHEREABOUTS next to a list of dates it says "COMMIT ROUNDSVILLE MENTAL INSTITUTION, DOCTOR: BERT TOKYO".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peters grabs his cel phone and dials a number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vic, it's Peters. Yeah, I'm up late. Look, we got a problem. That blood sample from the girl's fingertips--came back a match to a DOJ sex offender named Doug Richardson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something from the other end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, not Heston and get this: He's got Leber's congenital amaurosis. No I didn't make that up. It's a rare disease, normally causes blindness, but in some cases it can cause the sclera of the eye to turn black. And to top it off, this guy was a psych case over at Roundsville and you'll never guess who his doctor was. (smiles as Vic guesses) Right. I think he had two people trying to kill her. Send some uniforms over to her house, have them wake her up and secure it. Call me when that's done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vic says something on his end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. Hey, see if we can get some pics of this guy. Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hangs up, but looks worried.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE AUDITORIUM
dialogues.text: Tuck rushes Lynn up the stairs to the door at the top. He peers through the small window--coast looks clear--then l the way through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're on the second floor, a small level overlooking th front lobby. A stairway leads down the front.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tuck moves to the projection-room door and pulls on it. I locked; a numeric keypad is set into the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whisper) Knock on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too loud. He's got his radio on in there anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tuck tries a combination, pulls gently. Still locked. He tries another, pulls again. Locked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn takes a look at the keypad. Five numbers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you kidding? There's a hundred and twenty combinations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have another idea?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He keeps trying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The clown stands in the center of the lobby. Whatever he with the paper, there's no sign of it now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's listening. The sound of Tuck trying combinations can barely be heard, and from the lobby it's hard to know whe it's coming from.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The clown hefts his axe and walks back toward the auditoriums, passing the stairwell to the second floor. H suddenly stops though, realizing the sound is coming from above him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He backtracks and begins climbing the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn has moved to the top of the stairs and is peering do them. Suddenly, the top of the clown's head comes into he sightline, but because of the angle, he doesn't see her. She rushes back to Tuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (harsh whisper) He's coming!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tuck's still trying combos. Nothing's working.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If he gets to the top, run back into the theater.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He keeps going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: is halfway up the stairs. He can definitely hear them now The paint smile on his face seems to widen. His stride, however, doesn't quicken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn's petrified, watching the stairs with her back again the wall. Anticipating the appearance of her deepest fear brought to life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And appear he does. Slowly, inevitably, his head appears, then his axe. Step by step he's almost to the top.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tuck looks quickly, goes back to the codes. As the clown to the top step, the door surprises all three of them by opening to Tuck's pull.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They dart in to the projection room as the clown rushes a them. Tuck pulls the door shut just in time as the clown slams into it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The clown pulls on the door, but it's locked again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn and Tuck take a breather. Safe for the moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no one in sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He may be on the second level. (points to the phone) Call the police. I'll go find him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She goes to the phone and picks it up. For a moment you c see that she thinks it's going to be dead, but it's not. a prayer answered, she's got a dial tone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hits 911.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peters is dressed now and heading for the door. He forget his keys, goes back for them on the counter, and his radi CRACKLES to life, scaring the crap out of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's not at the house. It's empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No sign of a break in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope. However, dispatch just got a 911 from a woman who says she's, uh, being chased by a killer clown. At the Columbia Golden Arts theater.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They have units on the way?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell the supervising seargent I'm ten minutes away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He rushes out the door.
