dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tuck comes down the stairs. Lynn's running his way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you get through?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. I left the phone off the hook. They say they're on the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods) Good. Jeff isn't up there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't think he's...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope not. Come on, let's see if the back door's open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leads her toward the door the clown originally came in stops suddenly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's been here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tries to block her view, but she sees anyway. Jeff sit his back against the door. Blood glistens all over him an his eyes are wide open, forever staring at nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is the door open?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tuck gently moves Jeff's body out of the way, then tries door. Doesn't move. He throws himself against it, but it still doesn't budge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn begins searching through Jeff's pants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking for keys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tuck's surprised by her initiative; you don't see him goi through the dead guy's pants. She finishes, coming up emp

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shakes her head, hopeless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four patrol cars with flashing lights are parked in front the theater as Detective Peters pulls up in his unmarked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One OLDER COP hurries over to intercept Peters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Detective Peters, homicide. Where's your sarge?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hasn't shown up yet. All the doors are locked, I got guys on perimeter around the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why haven't you gone in? There's a woman trapped in there with-- well, a murderer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't go in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cop motions him over, they go to the front door. A pi of paper is taped on the glass door facing out. Written i child-like scrawl are the words "COME IN THEY DIE".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peters sees it, refrains from cursing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've called in the tac team.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This guy's not taking hostages.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The older cops shrugs. Nothing he can do. Peters knows it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dammit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stares in through the glass impotently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tuck and Lynn rush back to the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell them we're trapped in the projection room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn picks up the phone, which she left off the hook. Tuc looking around for a weapon. The best he finds is a broom with detachable end. He unscrews it and is left with a fi foot pole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She clicks the hang-up button a couple of times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The line's dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The junction box where all the phone lines come in and go out. They're hanging out of the box like stray hair, havi been ripped out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have your cel phone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes her head) It's in my car. You?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't want anyone to get in touch with me tonight. Okay, no problem. We can wait it out here. The cops should be here any minute. We'll just wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn moves to a group of doors, if only to keep herself b The one on the left has a restroom sign on it. The other doors have nothing on them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where do these go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tuck comes over and shrugs. Then he KICKS one door, shattering the lock and throwing it open. He reaches in a flicks on the light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (answering her question) Manager's office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They check out the room. Lynn confirms the phones don't w in this room either. Tuck's interested in a giant monitor with buttons on it. The monitor shows different parts of the theater; every camera in the building is patched into it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tuck pushes a button and the view switches to one particu camera. He pushes another and it moves to another camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take a look at this. (she does) Security cameras.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tuck pushes button after button, searching for any sign o the clown. He doesn't seem to be on any of the cameras.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tuck hits the button that shows all sixteen cameras at on time. Two of the monitors show the outside parking lot wh has police cars and officers all around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look. The cops are here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn smiles with relief, but the smile dies as she realiz something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are they waiting for? Why aren't they coming in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tuck sees what she means. The cops seem to be taking up s positions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh...I don't know. Unless they think he's got us hostage...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So we're on our own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now that it's been said out loud, it starts to sink in. T tries to be optimistic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry. We're safe here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sound of METAL HITTING PLEXIGLASS makes Lynn jump. It happens AGAIN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit. He can reach the projection window from the smaller theaters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can he get through?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHACK! Then silence. Lynn and Tuck move out of the room a wait in the center of the aisle, staring down past the projectors into the darkness. Expecting the clown to appe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then WHACK!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a moment of silence, Tuck leads Lynn slowly toward where the sound came from. Bracing for the next slam, but silence drags.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They approach the window looking down into the theater. V slow. Like the clown's face is going to appear suddenly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't, but what they see in the theater takes Lynn's breath away. Shock. Fear. Hopelessness. It's all reflecte her expression.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sotto voce) Oh shit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The clown stands in front of the theater screen, his axe gripped in his left hand. His right hand rests on the shoulder of Nicholas, who stands there in a daze. For som reason the boy doesn't seem to be afraid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The clown sees them in the window. He looks at Nicholas, back to Lynn and Tuck. His look says everything: The boy you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll distract him. You get Nicky out of there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shock seems to have focused Lynn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. He'll kill you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn's sudden calmness worries Tuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. I'm not gonna let anything happen to either of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm okay. I'm okay. (reassuring smile) I'm going out there but I need you to do something for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (can't believe it) You're what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm tired...I'm tired of being scared. And I won't let him hurt my son. Now listen to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The clown stares at the now-empty window into the project room. Nicky's having a hard time keeping his eyes open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The clown turns. Lynn stands at the foot of the theater. Defiant and angry, but it's impossible for her to complet conceal her fear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm here. Let him go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The clown turns. Sees her. He smiles, but it's a gruesome sadistic smile made even more hideous by his makeup. He releases the boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come here, Nicky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He does. Lynn kneels down in front of him, keeping her ey on the clown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quiet) Nicky, I want you to go outside and wait for me. Understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks out, casting one glance back at his mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When he's gone, the clown takes a step toward Lynn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait! (the clown stops) Why are you doing this? What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To get...better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He moves to the aisle. Lynn moves into a row of seats to as much distance as possible between them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But why me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was your fault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One step at a time the clown comes up. Lynn backs up unti she's at the foot of the other aisle. She backs her way farther up the stairs as the clown begins to cross the ro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's half-way up when he gets to the foot of the aisle leading up to her. Gaining ground even though he's not rushing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts a foot on the stair. Lynn's not moving. Too petri to move...or waiting?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The clown takes another step, his grip on the axe tighten

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The clown stops. Lynn's terrified, trying to hide it. Desperate. Hoping this works.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Without turning her own head, she points back toward the projection booth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Instinctually, the clown does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A blinding BEAM OF LIGHT streaks out of the projector redirected at the clown. It's a broad beam, 30,000 candle watts of power, full in the face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He YELLS IN PAIN, turning away, but too late. He's blinde maybe permanently. Lynn shields her eyes and slides her w across the row of seats. Still averting her eyes from the light, she accidentally kicks over a soda. The clown hears it, YELLS ANGRILY. He climbs the stairs to her level and moves in her direction trying to hone in on the sound. He swings the axe in fron him, even though he's not close to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The projector light is no longer following him. Lynn's frozen, watching as the clown feels his way across the se

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coming closer. Lynn moves away, accidentally kicking ice the soda she just knocked down. The ice makes TIC TIC sou as it falls to the next level.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The clown, now knowing he's on the right track, starts to move quickly toward her through the row.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn turns and runs. The clown follows, stumbling against seats in his blind chase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her shoes now wet, Lynn slips as she tries to cut out of aisle, crashes against the wall. She turns--the clown sta above her, his axe raised to deliver the killing blow--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The clown turns toward the voice. He can't see it, but Tu holding a broom handle like a baseball bat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tuck swings for the fences. The pole splinters in half as THWACKS into the clown's forehead. He falls back against stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tuck pulls Lynn to her feet and pushes her ahead of him. turns to look back at the clown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amazingly, the clown is already standing, the axe raised his head for a huge swipe at Tuck. Tuck's got nowhere to In desperation, he lunges at the clown and grasps the axe handle as it starts its downward arc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He manages to stop it, but he has to hold on for dear lif The clown is much stronger than he is, and now can feel h The clown releases one hand from the axe and grabs Tuck b the throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With an iron grip, the clown begins to choke him. Tuck desperately grasps out like the clown, his hand grabbing the clown's throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He squeezes, but the clown doesn't seem bothered. Just co his head slightly and continues to choke the life out of Tuck pushes the axe to the side and SLUGS the clown in th face. The clown is stunned for a second. Tuck PUNCHES him again. It seems to have the opposite effect, and brings t clown out of his daze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The clown swings the axe with his left hand in a swipe me to cut Tuck in half at the stomach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tuck barely catches it again. The clown's getting pissed. He's still got a grip on Tuck's neck, and he uses it to t Tuck to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes his wood-chopping grip and raises the axe for a massive swing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DROP IT OR YOU'RE DEAD!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The clown turns his head to the new threat. Detective Pet and two cops stand at the entry to the auditorium, and ev one of them has a gun pointed at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The clown turns back to Tuck, a hateful sneer on his face looks like he's gonna chop him anyway. Peters' finger tightens on the trigger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DON'T!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The clown looks back to the cops. The tension finally rel from his grip. He throws the axe to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peters motions the cops over to the clown, and doesn't ta his sights off until he's securely cuffed. He goes over t Tuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He extends a hand to Tuck and helps him up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is the biggest fucking clown I have ever seen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn, hugging Nicky protectively, and Tuck are in the lob of the theater, again strobed by flashing red and blue li from the police cars outside. Detective Peters finishes talking to some of the cops and joins them, a grim look on his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How you holding up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're okay. What about Julie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's dead.  I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tuck tries to comfort Lynn by putting his arm around her. a moment, the three almost look like a family. Peters not this and seems to feel a little awkward, shifts uncomfort

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The paramedics are going to need to take Nicholas to the hospital for a while. Just do a few tests. You can ride in the ambulance if you want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She nods, shock setting in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll follow you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They follow Peters outside toward the flashing lights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn, dead tired, on her way home from the hospital. Nich is asleep in the passenger seat. There's a BEEP from the seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At first Lynn doesn't notice it. It BEEPS again, and she remembers her cel phone in the back seat. She grabs it an sees she has a message.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She dials her voice mail and listens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Today, two thirty-four a.m.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (weak, barely audible) Lynn...Lynn...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The line goes dead. Lynn looks at her car clock: 3:32 Lynn has a terrible thought. What if the clown went to Phillip's like he did to Julie's? She dials the phone, ge a BUSY signal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no...Phillip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns down a side street, headed toward Phillip's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not many lights on at Phillip's house. Lynn looks at Nick still asleep, then back to Phillip's. Nothing looks amiss Phillip could be asleep. Maybe it was nothing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She locks the car doors and heads up the walkway. At the front door she pauses. It's open a crack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pushes the door open, dreading what she's about to se while dialing 911 on her cel phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place is trashed. Chairs and tables overturned. Pictu ripped from the walls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn makes herself go in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phillip...? Please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She moves in, completely expecting to find Phillip's body the phone in her hand forgotten. Bracing herself for what she's about to find.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She can't believe it. She starts to move toward his voice but stops when she sees him. He's standing in the hall, h back to her. Something's not right though...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard it on the police scanner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phillip, what...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phillip turns, but the face that meets her is nightmarish His face is roughly painted, like he did it himself. He l like the shark-toothed clown from one of her paintings. L recoils, confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not really scared. Yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He didn't kill you. I had my doubts; he wasn't the brightest bulb, was he? I think he actually believed it was his parents that your dad drove off the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What...what are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phillip strolls into the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not one for long explanations. Suffice it to say I've been keeping my eye on you for a long time now. Over twenty years. There was a time I thought I could simply forget what you did...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls a large butcher knife out of the drawer and hold up, inspecting its edge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course, that didn't last. And now...now, you're going to move away? You think you can get away from me now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's moving slowly around the room. Discretely putting himself closer to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand...what--why are you dressed like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see it like it was yesterday. I was twelve. Sitting on the bench in the waiting area. Doctors rushing around...hurt, sick people everywhere. That awful smell...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's rambling, staring at the blade, mesmerized by his reflection maybe, but now he's closer to the front door t Lynn is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what I keep remembering--it haunts me in my sleep--was those policemen who walked by. (mimics one) "The little girl, she distracted him. Drove right into them."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then his gaze locks on her. She doesn't know what he's talking about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew Bert, you know. He treated me for years. That's how I met Doug--the clown. He was so nuts that it didn't take much to convince him that killing you would make him all better. Of course, he was a loaded gun. He came after me tonight, but...I straightened him out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His expression goes grim. Lynn can't absorb it, doesn't understand any of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, you can ask your dad what I'm talking about when you visit him in hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He raises the blade and rushes at her. She stumbles back, shoving a tall lamp in his way. He trips over it and fall catching himself at the last second. He regains a measure his dignity, brushing at his pants as he stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It might be funny if it weren't for the huge knife in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn's trying to stay cool even though she's deathly frightened of the way Phillip looks, the clown makeup covering his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phillip. Listen to me. I'm your friend. I want to help you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then please...let me stab you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He feints her way her again. She dodges around the side o the sofa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phillip--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop calling me that. My name is Shane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are circling each other, the sofa a barrier between

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like to know why you're so afraid of clowns?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She does, but she says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the hospital, some vapid nurse told you your parents were never coming back so you started crying. There was a clown at the hospital trying to cheer up the kids that day and...he came up behind you and touched your shoulder. I guess he was trying to make you smile. But...you saw him and wouldn't stop screaming bloody murder. (beat) Isn't it interesting how that one moment has shaped the rest of your life?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you've been...following me all these years?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn's expression says just how nuts that is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Amanda? Julie? Even Nicky?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FUCK you, Lynn! What about my parents? What about ME?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She surprises him by moving a little closer, her face sho sympathy and kindness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phillip...you're nuts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She punches him square in the face. He's shocked, and hur falls back on his ass as blood starts to gush from his no

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn turns and runs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She rushes to the car, fumbling at her keyring for the ca key. She gets to her door, still sorting through her keys naturally, she drops them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phillip bursts out the door, furious. He sees her car, th she's not in it. He turns to look the other direction as stands up with the right key in her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hears, turns toward her. Too late--she's unlocked the and slid in. He rushes over as the car starts, leaping on hood as if he can stop her from getting away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In reverse, she guns it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phillip slides off and hits the driveway painfully. Lynn braked her car short of the road. She puts it in park. St at Phillip as he slowly stands up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at Nicky in the back seat, still asleep. Something's going through her mind but it's hard to tell it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phillip is walking toward the car now. Twenty feet away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn puts her hand on the shift lever. Takes a good look the letters. R D N 1 2 3. Reverse takes her away from the nightmare walking toward her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phillip is fifteen feet away and closing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn pulls the lever down. Was it one click or two?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stomps on a pedal and her car surges forward. Phillip time to raise the knife before the car hits him, tossing back into the yard like a rag doll.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She checks on Nicky--still buckled up and unbelievably st asleep. Back to front where Phillip lies in an unmoving h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn lays her head on the steering wheel in utter exhaust as SIRENS can be heard approaching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PHONE RINGS, and Lynn bolts upright in bed. She snatc it off the hook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn? Thank God you answered. I don't want you to panic--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? What's happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I've got men on the way, they'll be there any second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (exhales) Doug Richardson--the clown...he escaped from the prison. I'm sure he's headed out of state as fast as he can go, but I'm sending men over there just to be safe. I want you to stay calm...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not sure, we--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's already put the phone down and is moving down the h toward Nicholas' room. Detective Peters keeps talking, bu his voice soon fades away to nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She passes Nicholas' room and goes to the front door. Che the locks. Still locked, the security chain latched.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relieved, she moves back to Nicholas' room. His door is h closed, and pitch dark inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pushes the door open, but it's still too dark to see Nicholas' bed. Lynn flicks on the light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The light comes on for an instant and immediately blows o But in the snapshot flash Lynn sees the clown standing in front of her son's bed looking down on him, and at the fl of the switch, the clown begins to turn her way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is pitch-black before their eyes can meet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn's fear is all-consuming. She unwittingly moves back against the wall, staring into the dark gaping hole into son's room, so suddenly a mouth into madness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too paralyzed to scream, Lynn stares into the darkness, waiting for the clown to appear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At any second, the clown's horrid face will loom out of t black, like a floating head, leering at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn's lip trembles. She can't blink. Fear grips her ever muscle.
